thread.title: Real Madrid's Gareth Bale fouls Keylor Navas but still wins free-kick v Villarreal | Metro News
thread.title_full: Real Madrid's Gareth Bale fouls Keylor Navas but still wins free-kick v Villarreal | Metro News

author: Evan Bartlett For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Real Madrid's Gareth Bale fouls Keylor Navas but still wins free-kick v Villarreal | Metro News
text:
Evan Bartlett for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 10:23 am There were no other players near the incident (La Liga) 
Real Madrid were the recipients of two favourable refereeing decisions on Sunday night as they came back from two goals down to beat Villarreal 3-2. 
Alvaro Morata’s late winner secured the three points as Los Blancos regained their lead at the top of La Liga. 
But the crucial moment of the match came when referee Jesus Gil Manzano adjudged that Villarreal’s Bruno Soriano had handled in the box. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
While the ball did appear to strike Bruno’s arm, the midfielder had very little time to react as the ball ricocheted off teammate Victor Ruiz from Toni Kroos’ shot. 
That incident – which led to Cristiano Ronaldo’s equaliser from the penalty spot – caused Barcelona defender Gerard Pique to take to Twitter claiming that referees are biased in favour of Madrid. Bale scored Madrid’s opener as they mounted a comeback at Estadio de la Ceramica (Fotopress/Getty Images)
